page.title: 02Holt Heath Nature Reserve
page.content: There are 1200 acres of land on the heath.The NCC have a 21 year lease to the land previously owned by a farmer who had tried to improve the grazing by ploughing it up and reseeding ,he adandoned this attempt. The site contains some very interesting plants and animals some of which are now becoming rare especially the wet heathland species,and although there are no plants protected by law there are species of animals,including the Dorset Sand Lizard and the Dorset Smooth Snake. Although there are deer grazing on the site, it being bordered to the S&W by forest the wardens do not look after the deer although there are many of them, they do however help run the annual cull to ensure that the heath is not overgrazed or a farming pest.
